cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the extremality of binary input DMCs under the uniform input distribution, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The concept of channel polarization is also central to the paper, which is a technique used in coding theory and communication systems (cs.CC). The paper also involves analyzing the evolution of a function under transformations, which is a common theme in discrete mathematics and theoretical computer science (cs.DS). The paper's focus on extremality and optimization also suggests that it could belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) or social and information networks (cs.SI).
